alert.note: Alert for Stark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 11:09PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EDT SUNDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following county, Stark. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1109 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain and flooding on the West Branch of Nimishillen Creek. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Canton, Green, North Canton, Louisville, Hartville, East Canton, Meyers Lake, Hills And Dales, Greentown, Uniontown and Perry Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
